result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent L. SIEVERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Count 1 - OWI (5th) - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, resisting an officer substantial bodily harm and count 3, fleeing an officer.   Motion granted.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for twelve (12) months, under the Huber Law, to commence today.   Transfer to Calumet County Jail is authorized.   
Pay $2,000.00 fine, plus costs, total of $3,543.00, to be paid by 07-14-17 or 62 days jail.   $500.00 cash bail applied.   
Thirty-six (36) months driver's license revocation.   
Thirty-six (36) months ignition interlock.  
Submit DNA sample.   
AODA assessment and follow through.  
Minutes.

Letter from defendant to the court. 
Letter from Thomas J. Pritzl counselor.

RE:  OWI - 5th offense, on 03-12-15.

At 2:27 p.m., $500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of fleeing an officer, OWI - 5th offense and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he not operate a motor vehicle and maintain absolute sobriety.
